body: $PQEFF Tonight's PR could mean more progress with the exchange than I thought.  The amended notes referred to in tonight's PR (April 21
column3: July 2) are the only 3 outstanding unconverted notes mentioned in the Oct 6 PR.  All other notes mentioned in the Oct 6 PR have been converted

body: $PQEFF What I want to know now is how many non-compliant unconverted notes still have to be amended and upon amendment of all such notes will the company have satisfied the exchange.

$PQEFF  No one likes to see dilution but I'm not sure that's the major takeaway here.  It's only 4M shares issued under an existing note which is less than 1% of os shares.  It's the amendments to the unconverted notes that caught my attention.

$PQEFF Could this actually be... dare I say it....progress? Maybe partial satisfaction of conditions set by the exchange to lift the halt?  They're doing retro amendments of pre-halt unconverted notes to being coversion prices in line with exchange requirements.  This is pretty much all they can do to comply with the exchange's conversion price policy at this point
created_at: other than to pay a fine.
